author: Vishwa Kundapura
text:
Deputy Commissioner K.V. Thrilokchandra on Friday assured prospective industrialists of all cooperation in providing infrastructure in the district.

He was inaugurating ‘Invest Kolar 2016’, a district-level investors’ meet organised by the district administration, Department of Industries and Commerce, and District Industrial Centre (DIC), on the zilla panchayat premises.

“Rs. 5,000 crore had been invested in the industrial units in the district in the last five years,” Mr. Thrilokchandra said, adding that 10,000 jobs had been generated during the period. Industrialisation in Kolar had been faster than any other district, he said. DIC Joint Director V.T. Venkatesh said Kolar had the potential of being developed as an alternative industrial hub to Bengaluru.

About 100 prospective investors participated in the meet and exchanged MoUs with the administration.

100 prospective investors exchange MoUs with district administration at ‘Invest Kolar-2016’
title: Kolar DC assures full support for investors
